title: Logging onto chat service... (Help & Discussion)
body:
Last night/Early this morning my game was working perfectly fine, but when I logged in this afternoon I first get stuck with the:
1. Security certificate problem (THIS IS FIXED) where none of the links/videos/articles on the home screen loads but right after that
2. I get the "Logging onto chat service... problem where I cannot see my friends/list, invite or join games by my friends or see my clan chat.

I've looked around and tried everything under the sun and have not found a resolution to my problem and was wondering how many other people are having the same problem? By my guess a good amount.

Some solutions that worked for other people includes:
A. Downloading the Digi certificates (fixed my security problem)
B. Changing dates/time ahead/behind before re-syncing
C. Deleting %temp% files (excluding ones that need to be skipped)
D. Uninstalling Akamai session
E. Resetting Internet Explorer
F. Stopping IP Helper in run services
G. Simply rebooting the program over and over/re-installing the program

I've spent the last 2 hours doing these things, nothing works (I may have also missed some solutions I tried)
About to install and logging into the riot mobile app/using a vpn/proxy service to get around this."
Can anyone else share their experiences and solutions that aren't listed please?
I see that this is happening to a lot of other people and only 1 out of 10 comments say that riot acknowledges and is working on the problem, the other 9 says that riot ignores it or tells you to check your ISP instead.

Thanks.

replies.body:
I've seen this issue quite a lot, and almost every time this issue pops up, it's caused by a local network configuration that doesn't play well with the League client. Every network setup is different, and even someone as close as your next door neighbor may have a *completely* different network than you. Because of this, some networks may have settings or configurations (modem settings) that may result in a poor connection to the servers. 

You certainly started with some good steps to take in troubleshooting this. I recommend your next step to be working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues), which has a good track record of resolving these types of issues. 

Let me know if you continue to see issues after following that guide.
